intro: Erucago dentata, commonly known as the toothed erucago, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
